thread.title: German minister to visit site after 200,000-litre pipeline oil leak - NewsBreak
thread.title_full: German minister to visit site after 200,000-litre pipeline oil leak - NewsBreak

author: DPA
title: German minister to visit site after 200,000-litre pipeline oil leak - NewsBreak
text:
By DPA ,
now
A major clean-up operation is under way in the German state of Brandenburg, which surrounds Berlin, after at least 200,000 litres of crude oil leaked from a pipeline on Wednesday evening.
The state's environment minister, Hanka Mittelstädt, is expected to visit the site near the village of Gramzow on Thursday to assess the damage, her ministry said.
The fire brigade said late Wednesday that clean-up operations would continue through the night and into Thursday.
The leak in the pipeline, which runs from Rostock to Schwedt, occurred on Wednesday evening during a workplace accident. At least 200,000 litres of crude oil escaped, according to estimates by the fire brigade.
According to the refinery operator PCK, initial findings suggest the incident was caused by preparatory work for a planned safety test on the pipeline. Deliberate interference has been ruled out, it said.
The oil shot several metres into the air from a small leak at a pumping station and landed on an agricultural field, the fire brigade said.
Alexander Trenn, head of the Schwedt fire brigade, told dpa the total amount spilled could be even higher and said the leak had continued for several hours.
Around 100 firefighters and 25 PCK employees were on site on Wednesday evening.
Special suction vehicles were deployed to collect the large quantity of oil, and crews worked with heavy machinery to contain the spread.
1
